Platform.Title: E. coli K12, Sakai and EDL933 genes (MGW oligonucleotide)
Platform.Manufacturer: Genomics Core Facility, National Microbiology Laboratory, Canadian Science Centre for Human and Animal Health, Public Health Agency of Canada.
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol: Oligo set used is the E. coli O157 set commercially provided by MWG-Biotech and supplemented with 104 additional oligos requested by Vic Gannon's group. All were 50'mers resuspended in fresh 50%DMSO to a final concentration of 50uM using a Biomek 2000 robotic liquid handler (Beckman Coulter Inc). Print plates were sealed and stored at -20C when not in use. Prior to printing arrays the oligo plates were allowed to come to room temperature then heated for 5min at 60C. Once cooled they were centrifuged for 3min at 3000rpm to collect all liquid prior to arraying. Arrays were printed on Corning UltraGAPS slides using Telechem SMP3 pins in a BioRad ChipWriter Pro arrayer. Arrays were printed at room temperature (21-23C) and at 58-60% relative humidity. Arrays were printed with 24 pins in a 4x6 arrangement such that each subgrid contains 18x16 spots with an interspot distance of 245 microns centre to centre and a spot diameter of 100 microns. Duplicate supergrids were created lengthwise across the slide so that two spots per oligo exist at separate locations on the array. When spotting was complete, the chamber humidification was turned off and the arrays were allowed to "dry" in the print chamber for a minimum of 6 hours. The slides were then cross-linked at 600mJ and packaged in the original slide holders that they were received in from Corning. For shipping, arrays were packaged with dessicant in foil heat sealed bags.

Column.Name: BLOCK
Column.Description: The number of the subarray starting left to right and up to down

Sample.Title: RPMI 1A, Microarray #1 first duplicate

Channel.Extract-Protocol: TRIzol reagent (Gibco BRL) was used according to the manufacturer instruction. RNA was treated with DNase (Ambion). RNA sample was converted to cDNA in 5 independent reverse-transcription reactions as described previously (Graham, J. 1999. PNAS 96:11554-559). Bacterial transcript were purified from host transcript by using 3 round of the SCOTS procedure (Daigle, F. 2002. Methods Enzymol. 358:108-122).
Channel.Label: Cy5

Channel.Growth-Protocol: EDL933 from overnight culture in LB broth
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Genomic DNA was extracted by standard phenol-chloroform method (Sambrook, J, Molecular Cloning, 3rd Edition)
Channel.Label: Cy3

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Dry the probe and then resuspend in 80ul of DIG 37°C for the Cy3 and Cy5 sample. Place the mixed probe at 95°C, 5 min and then chilled on ice 5 min. Depose the mixed probe on the microarray, cover with a cover-slip and place in an corning hybridation chamber.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Slide was scanned with Scan Array Lite (Perkin-Elmer) using Scan Array Express 2.1 software.
Sample.Description: This sample was used as a reference to an experiment of the effect of human macrophages phagocytosis on the global transcriptome of EDL933
Sample.Data-Processing: After backgroud correction and total intensity normalization, ratio to reference were calculated and log base 2 transformed

Column.Name: PRE-VALUE
Column.Description: ch1 % of total / ch2 % of total

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: log base 2 of ch1 % of total / ch2 % of total

Series.Title: EDL933 in human macrophage THP-1 cells at different time point
Series.Summary: Effect of human macrophages phagocytosis on the global transcriptome of EDL933 at different time. Infection of THP-1 with EDL933. Application of SCOTS technique to have cDNA. Hybridation on microarray. Reference: EDL933 in RPMI medium Keywords: stres response, host-bacteria response, time-course
Series.Overall-Design: For each time point, 2 microarray are analysed and on each microarray there is 2 replicate Total of 4 replicate for each time point (including reference medium)
